intro: Heteropterys pteropetala f. glabra, commonly known as the glabrous form of the velvetleaf, is a variant of the species characterized by its reduced pubescence. It is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. Its botanical features include a woody stem, palmate leaves, and capsules as fruits. This form is often studied for its morphological differences from the typical variety.
